snippet: Campaigning Republicans thought they could coast into office on a wave of public fury over health care reform. They thought wrong.
abstract: Editorial notes Republican congressional candidates are struggling to come up with coherent positions on the health care reform law, given growing public recognition that it is working; contends Republicans' positions on the law are murky; welcomes fact that some Democratic candidates are beginning to campaign on the law's benefits.
lead_paragraph: Campaigning Republicans thought they could coast into office on a wave of public fury over health care reform. They thought wrong.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
